title: Deion rips 'foolish' reports on Shedeur draft prep
content: Deion Sanders says he was "hurt" by reports that his son Shedeur Sanders was unprepared during predraft meetings with NFL teams, but he also isn't buying the validity of them, either.

title: Lions Pro Bowl center Ragnow says he's retiring
content: Lions center Frank Ragnow, a four-time Pro Bowl selection, announced his retirement on social media Monday.

title: Diggs at Pats OTA after absence, viral boat video
content: Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs was present for the team's voluntary OTA on Monday after he was absent all last week and made headlines for a video on a boat that had head coach Mike Vrabel stressing the importance of good decision-making.

title: Papi: Leave DH Devers alone about playing 1B
content: The Boston Red Sox should just leave designated hitter Rafael Devers alone and let him decide if he wants to start playing first base, Hall of Famer David Ortiz told The Associated Press on Monday.

title: Sources: Suns HC job down to Cavs' Bryant, Ott
content: The Suns, sources told ESPN, have narrowed their coaching search to two finalists from the Cavaliers -- associate coach Johnnie Bryant and assistant Jordan Ott.

title: Texas into WCWS finals for third time in 4 years
content: Texas defeated Tennessee 2-0 on Monday to reach the Women's College World Series championship series for the third time in four years.

title: Jazz hire Ainge's son away from C's as president
content: The Jazz have hired Austin Ainge away from the Celtics as president of basketball operations. Ainge, the son of Jazz CEO Danny Ainge, had been with Boston since 2009.

title: CCU coach calls UF's O'Sullivan 'bully' for rant
content: First-year Coastal Carolina baseball coach Kevin Schnall called Florida coach Kevin O'Sullivan a bully and disrespectful for his expletive-filled rant directed at site administrators before an elimination game at the NCAA Conway Regional.

title: 🎮 Eagles RB Barkley leaps onto Madden 26 cover
content: Eagles running back Saquon Barkley and his legendary reverse hurdle will be featured on the cover of Madden NFL 26.

title: Three potential Cooper Flagg trades the Mavericks might not immediately reject
content: What if the Mavs traded the draft's top pick? Our NBA insiders offer three enticing offers -- and a verdict.

title: 'I can't go on': The moment a 14-year-old Mike Tyson nearly quit in the ring
content: Mark Kriegel's excerpt from "Baddest Man: The Making of Mike Tyson" looks at the fights of a 14-year-old Tyson.

title: SGA, Haliburton lead Thunder, Pacers to surprise finals
content: The 2025 NBA Finals are here! Our NBA insiders break down everything you need to know ahead of this Pacers-Thunder championship showdown.

title: Three things this East finals run showed the Knicks
content: The Knicks' breakthrough postseason ended in the East finals, but there is plenty to build on in Gotham.

title: Sports betting isn't legal in all 50 states ... or is it?
content: A dispute between gambling regulators and an upstart company is testing what is a sports bet and what is not.

title: How Liam Coen went from UMass record holder to Jaguars coach
content: The Jaguars' first-year head coach has learned from Mark Whipple, Sean McVay and his dad. Now, he's building his own team.

title: Panthers-Oilers II: Key stats to know for the 2025 Stanley Cup Final
content: For the second consecutive season, it's Florida-Edmonton. Here's what you need to know before Game 1.

title: Florida, Houston rise in our men's NCAA top 25 after NBA draft withdrawal deadline
content: Did the Gators or Cougars do enough to earn No. 1? How the latest key offseason date shifted our projections.

title: How to quantify this NBA playoffs' growing trend
content: Don't be surprised to see a major comeback in the Finals because nobody has mastered the art like the Pacers.

title: Champions League win accomplished Qatar's PSG mission. Now what?
content: PSG's victory in Saturday's UEFA Champions League means that their Qatari owners have finally summited club football. Where do they go from here?

title: Man United's Bruno Fernandes dilemma: A future-defining decision
content: United are at a fork in the road with their captain. Do they take the money from Al Hilal, or keep their talisman?

title: Will anyone fill Nadal's beloved shoes at the French Open?
content: Nadal has left an indelible mark on the French Open -- but Swiatek, Alcaraz and others may be able to carry on the legacy.

title: Myth or reality? Examining the 'Madden curse' through the past 10 cover stars
content: The alleged curse on players who feature on the cover of the iconic NFL game is well known, but has it actually had merit over the past decade?

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: McDavid is Conn Smythe fave in Panthers rematch
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Plant vs. Charlo next? Is Canelo the ultimate goal for the winner?
content: Andreas Hale shares his thoughts on what should be next for both fighters after sharing the same boxing card on Saturday.

title: Has Verstappen's Spanish GP tantrum cost him F1 title shot?
content: Max Verstappen is already on the back foot in the F1 title fight. His Spain outburst didn't help his cause.

title: Waiver wire: Add Royals' Caglianone for power potential
content: Tristan H. Cockcroft outlines who should be claimed off the waiver wire, including potential slugger Jac Caglianone, and who should be dropped from fantasy rosters.

title: Atlético Madrid renew Griezmann contract to '27
content: Antoine Griezmann has signed a one-year contract extension at Atlético Madrid which would keep him at the club until June 30, 2027.

title: Sources: Klopp's former assistant to join Man City
content: Manchester City are closing in on a deal to name Pep Lijnders as part of Pep Guardiola's new-look backroom staff, sources have told ESPN.

title: Giráldez confirmed as new OL Lyonnes coach
content: Jonatan Giráldez has officially been announced as the new head coach of eight-time European women's champions OL Lyonnes.

title: Sources: City eye Aït-Nouri in summer rebuild
content: Manchester City are looking to sign Wolves full-back Rayan Ait-Nouri as part of their summer rebuild, sources have told ESPN.

title: Madrid's Huijsen wants to be like Sergio Ramos
content: Real Madrid's new signing Dean Huijsen has said he wants "to be like Sergio Ramos," praising the former Madrid captain as his "idol."

title: Prem players concerned over post-season tours
content: Players from Premier League teams have contacted the PFA, the players' union, to "express concern" over their involvement in post-season tours, PFA CEO Maheta Molango, has said.

title: Sources: Postecoglou to learn Spurs fate this week
content: Ange Postecoglou is set to learn his fate as Tottenham Hotspur manager this week, sources have told ESPN.

title: Seattle players demand fair MLS payout for CWC
content: Seattle Sounders FC players are demanding a fair share of the FIFA Club World Cup prize money the team secured when qualifying for the international tournament, and received backing from the Major League Soccer Players Association on Sunday.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Messi, Suárez help Miami surge up the list
content: With nine goals in two games, it's official: Inter Miami are back! Just how far have Messi & Co. jumped up ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Man Utd, Spurs want $75m Dibling
content: Four of the Premier League's biggest clubs are ready to battle for the signature of Southampton winger Tyler Dibling. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Rahul Gandhi Has His Task Cut Out For A Day's Visit To Haryana
content: Congress's Rahul Gandhi is expected to visit Chandigarh on June 4, with a list of tasks that is topped by the selection of a Leader of the Opposition.

title: Opinion: Elon Musk's Chatbot Can Be 'Non-Woke' Or Truthful, Not Both
content: Much like removing books on racism from a school library, "correcting" Grok's output requires an ugly intervention.

title: "Brainwashed": Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Ex-Aide On Sending Loving Texts Years After Rape
content: A former personal assistant to Sean "Diddy" Combs who says he raped her testified that she continued sending him loving text messages for years after her job ended in 2017 because she was "brainwashed."

title: New Electric Car Scheme Offers Import Tax Cuts To Makers For Local Production
content: The government will significantly lower import tax for foreign automakers that pledge to invest in domestic electric vehicle (EV) production, as it looks to strengthen local manufacturing and draw in global industry leaders.

title: Can Courts Interfere In Disputes Over Properties Of Ex Princely States? Top Court To Examine
content: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to examine whether Article 363 of the Constitution bars courts from hearing disputes relating to properties of erstwhile princely states mentioned under the pre-constitutional covenants.

title: Greenpeace Removes Wax Statue Of Macron Over French Trade With Russia
content: Greenpeace activists removed a wax statue of French President Emmanuel Macron from the Grevin Museum in Paris and put it in front of the Russian embassy to protest against French business ties with Russia.

title: AI Video: How Ukraine's Spider's Web Unleashed Hell On Russian Airbases
content: On the eve of peace talks, Ukraine launched a covert operation against Russia, described as one for the "history books" by Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Border Pillars To Be Placed In 5 "Disputed Areas" Along Assam-Meghalaya Boundary
content: In a definitive step towards the resolution of longstanding boundary differences between Assam and Meghalaya, the two state governments on Monday decided to erect border pillars in five of the disputed areas by Independence Day.

title: 2nd Phase Of Ayodhya Ram Temple's Consecration To Start From June 3
content: The second phase of the consecration ceremony at the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi temple in Ayodhya will begin on Tuesday, officials said.

title: Investment, Port Digitisation Discussed In India-Japan Meet On Maritime Ties
content: Investment, port digitisation and employment of Indian seafarers by Japan were among the topics discussed by Indian and Japanese ministers.

title: Himachal's 'Return Your Trash' Scheme As Mountains Drown In Garbage
content: Plastic bags and bottles strewn everywhere, animals scavenging on dumped solid waste - the disturbing scene is not from a dumpsite but from a forest in Himachal Pradesh's Kasol.

title: Portal To Register Waqf Properties Soon, Will Aim At Transparency: Sources
content: The verdict on challenges to the amended Waqf law put on hold by the Supreme Court, the government has decided to move forward with the registration of Waqf properties.

title: Man Beaten To Death Over Suspicion Of Mango Theft In Gujarat, 5 Arrested
content: Five persons were arrested on Monday for allegedly beating a farm labourer to death over suspicion of theft of mangoes worth Rs 50,000 from an orchard in Gujarat's Surat district, a police official said.

title: "Why Target Us?" Fear In Delhi's Batla House As Demolition Deadline Looms
content: Fear and anxiety is palpable among the residents of Delhi's Batla House as they face eviction notices from the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) and the Uttar Pradesh Irrigation Department, with demolitions looming as early as June 11.

title: Mentally Challenged Siblings Allegedly Sexually Harassed By Uttarakhand School Caretaker
content: Two mentally challenged brothers from Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad district were allegedly beaten and sexually harassed by the caretaker of a boarding school in Dehradun, the police said. Their statements will be recorded in a court, the cops added.

title: 'Forest Blizzard', 'Fancy Bear': Cyber Companies Vs Hacker Nicknames
content: Microsoft, CrowdStrike, Palo Alto and Alphabet's Google said they would create a public glossary of state-sponsored hacking groups and cybercriminals, in a bid to ease confusion over the menagerie of unofficial nicknames for them.

title: Man Convicted For Burning Quran Outside London's Turkish Consulate
content: A man who set fire to a copy of the Quran outside the Turkish consulate in London was found guilty of committing a religiously aggravated public order offence, in a verdict critics said effectively reinstated an abolished blasphemy law.

title: Russia-Ukraine Talks Barely Last An Hour, Progress On PoWs, Dead Soldiers
content: The second round of direct talks between Russia and Ukraine have begun in Istanbul hours after a massive drone strike in Russia's Siberia - a first since the beginning of the war.

title: 1 Month After Pahalgam Attack, Tourism In Kashmir Starts Journey To Normalcy
content: The tourism sector in Kashmir has started the long journey to normalcy as tourists, though in smaller numbers, are returning to the valley after the Pahalgam terror attack dealt a big blow to the industry.

title: Father Of Six Killed 'For Piece Of Bread' During Gaza Aid Distribution
content: Cries of grief echoed across southern Gaza's Nasser Hospital as dozens came to mourn Hossam Wafi, after the father of six was killed while attempting to get supplies to feed his family.

title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar government over death of minor rape victim at govt. hospital
content: It is alleged that the critically injured nine-year-old remained in an ambulance for several hours for want of bed

title: Rahul Gandhi approaches Jharkhand High Court challenging a non-bailable warrant
content: The case is related to Mr. Gandhi’s speech against Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders in March 2018

title: For most residents of Pakistan Tola in Bihar, the village name is an embarrassment
content: Ever since the Pahalgam attacks in April this year, people of Pakistan Tola in Bihar’s Purnia district have been demanding to change the name of the village they have been living in for years

title: Adani says it doesn't handle Iranian cargo, unaware of any U.S. probe into Iran sanctions violations
content: It went on to state that the Adani group "does not manage or facilitate any ships whose owners are Iranian. This policy is strictly adhered to across all our ports".

title: Hoardings that pose a threat to public safety yet to be removed
content: Outdoor advertisers in Kozhikode city yet to act despite SHRC directive; residents warn of serious monsoon-season risks; Corporation promises strict follow-up action within a week

title: Praveshanolsavam marks school reopening in district
content: Minister G.R. Anil inaugurates the district-level Praveshanolsavam at Government Higher Secondary School, Kavalayoor, Attingal, on Monday

title: Dam protests: NHRC issues notice to Arunachal government
content: According to the reports, on May 23, 2025, a Human Rights activist and Convenor of the Siang Indigenous Farmers Forum led a protest against the dam construction in Beging village in which approximately 400 people participated.

title: Celebrations mark reopening of schools in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: The Praveshanolsavam (school opening day celebration) unfolded as a grand cultural event, full of colour, music, and community spirit

title: IAP Kerala comes out with guidelines for students, parents and schools
content: The school authorities and parents should create awareness about substance abuse among students, says IAP functionaries

title: For students of Vellarmala school, a new chapter in life
content: They were welcomed by teachers, accompanied by a band; 25 high school and 11 higher secondary teachers honoured on the occasion

title: CHOs express concern over delay in receiving salaries
content: The CHOs have been on a strike for more than a month demanding payment of pending incentives, an increase in their pay of ₹25,000, regularisation of services of those who completed six years and resumption of PF

title: UDF to step up stir against alleged corruption in Kozhikode Corpn.
content: ‘The recent Vigilance raid on the office and home of the Superintending Engineer is an attempt to save the bigger fish by sacrificing a smaller one’

title: Maharashtra records 873 COVID-19 cases since January, 10 deaths reported
content: Public Health Department confirms surge in infections; genome sequencing and surveillance surveys underway

title: Dilip Ghosh’s absence at Modi, Shah events sparks speculation over internal rift in Bengal BJP
content: Ghosh says he was absent from events because he was not invited to them; talk of division in the ranks continues as the party is yet to pick a president for the State unit

title: Missing Indore man’s body recovered from gorge in Meghalaya; search for wife on
content: Police drone find the body of Raja Raghuvanshi after an eight-day search; couple went missing on May 24

title: Union Home Secretary visits Kuki-Zo relief camps in Manipur, attends security review meeting with Governor
content: The visit comes in the wake of fresh protests and a ‘civil disobedience” call by Meitei groups in the northeastern State

title: India, Paraguay can expand trade with MERCOSUR, says PM Modi
content: New opportunities to be explored in areas such as digital technology, critical minerals, energy, agriculture, healthcare, defence, railways, space, and overall economic partnership

title: U.K. Minister discussed border security with Indian officials in April
content: The U.K Home Office said that, in the past one year, there had been a 45% increase in Indian nationals detained by the immigration authorities, including people who were to be returned

title: Rare migratory bird sighted on Kappad beach five years ago identified as Caspian Gull
content: The Caspian Gull, usually found in Central Asia, visits northwestern India, such as Gujarat, in winter. It was sighted in Goa only once and never again in south India until this time, says Kozhikode-based ornithologist

title: Ponguleti says Revenue Department at the ‘People’s Doorstep’ from Tuesday
content: Revenue Sadassus in which revenue teams, led by Tahsildars, will travel to each revenue village, accepting applications and resolving issues on the site will resume from Tuesday to cover all villages

title: Five from two families killed, two injured in road accidentin East Godavari
content: The incident occurred when a car, in which the seven persons were returning from Kakinada beach, hit a milk tank from behind on Kakinada-Rajahmundry ADB road.

title: Rahul Gandhi to launch campaign to revamp Congress in Madhya Pradesh
content: Rahul will visit the State and hold separate meetings with political affairs committee, the party’s MPs and MLAs in the State, among others

title: Kolkata Police defend arrest of influencer over ‘hate speech’
content: BJP terms action against Sharmistha Panoli as political vendetta; police say arrest in line with legal provisions

title: Pakistan too sends delegations abroad to present its case
content: Teams to call for international “role” in the region, and plead Pakistan’s case for the restoration of Indus Waters Treaty, suspended by India after the Pahalgam terror attack

title: 153 acre green space to come up soon in North Bengaluru
content: An Indira Gandhi Biological Park, Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Bird Park, Kempegowda Zoo, Saalumarada Thimmakka Arboretum among others are being planned to be set up

title: U.K. is with India against terrorism: Indo-Pacific Minister tells all-party delegation
content: Group led by MP Ravi Shankar Prasad conveys India’s concerns regarding Pakistan, addresses Indian diaspora in London

title: Medigadda Barrage collapse: 17 officials to face criminal charges and 33 disciplinary action
content: Vigilance Commission finds fault with L&T Precision Engineering Systems (L&T-PES) for lapses on several fronts and recommends steps to follow in future

title: Centre calls for proposals to set up de-addiction centres in 291 ‘gap’ districts
content: The highest number of ‘gap’ districts have been identified in Chhattisgarh, where 31 of the State’s 33 districts have figured in the list

title: Protests at Idukki school over cancellation of English medium division
content: Parents say they were intimated of the move asked to shift students to Malayalam medium or other schools only on May 30. DDE asks teachers to ensure that future studies of students remain unaffected

title: Senior Rajasthan IAS officer Alok passes away
content: Additional Chief Secretary in Rajasthan’s Energy Department succumbed to cancer; remembered for expertise in energy sector

title: KAHWA accuses Kerala government of being vengeful towards ASHAs
content: KAHWA accuses government of slashing ASHAs’ honorarium of ₹7,000 by bringing in new caveats regarding incentives

title: It is a straight fight between LDF, UDF in Nilambur, says Congress
content: All India Congress Committee (AICC) general secretary (Organisation) K.C. Venugopal says Anvar and belated entrants into the electoral fray, including the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), were not a factor in the crucial bypoll

title: INDIA bloc to push for special session of parliament on Pahalgam attack
content: As per sources, the Opposition was undecided on whether to pen a joint letter or to get every Opposition MP to send a separate plea for a joint session.

title: Police to launch Campus Beats against drugs in Idukki schools
content: The project is a joint initiative of the school authorities, Parent Teachers’ Associations, parents, and the public, says District Police Chief at the district’s Praveshanolsavam

title: Integrated hostel with 1,000 intake inaugurated in Dharwad
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi says providing quality education and skill training should be a top priority

title: NCC, Shapoorji & Pallonji, and L&T to build five towers in Amaravati at ₹3,673 crore
content: CRDA approves their bids for GAD Tower, HoD Towers 1 and 2, and 3 and 4 at ₹882 crore, ₹1,488 crore and ₹1,303 crore respectively; Municipal Administration Minister P. Narayana says CRDA approved issue of Letters of Agreement to the firms with the mandate to begin the works immediately

title: NASSCOM delegation discusses Andhra Pradesh’s tech vision with Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh is a compelling alternative to saturated hubs, offering  a unique advantages for India’s growing tech sector, says Naidu

title: Two gruesome murders shock West Bengal; bodies recovered in separate incidents
content: In Malda, man’s body found buried in a wall; in South 24 Parganas, accused parades severed head of sister-in-law

title: Rail users seek diversion of  express trains on the new Karaikal-Peralam BG section
content: Nagore Nagapattinam Rail Users’ Association has submitted a memorandum to the Chief Passenger Transportation Manager, Southern Railway, about diverting three long-distance trains

title: Little Afghani girl steps into world of letters from Kottayam
content: Behsa Karimi joins Grade I at Government LP School, Mudiyoorrkkara here. She is the daughter of an MGU research scholar hailing from Afghanistan

title: Centre notifies guidelines to boost electric car production
content: Decision comes on a day Union Minister Kumaraswamy said Tesla was not interested in manufacturing cars in India

title: Monsoon in lull phase after intense spells, to be active after June 10
content: Eight days of monsoon have given a whopping 440 mm of rain to the State against the average of 81.5 mm, around 440% excess rainfall

title: Sanjay Raut demands Ajit Pawar’s resignation over alleged ‘loot of funds’ in Ladki Bahin scheme
content: ‘Ajit Pawar allowed men to avail benefits under the names of women, and let government employees become beneficiaries just to receive votes,’ the Shiv Sena (UBT) MP said

title: Trial run of modern abattoir to begin on environment day in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The plant at Kunnukuzhy, built at a cost of ₹15 crore, has a capacity to handle 75 larger animals and 50 small animals per day. It will also have a capacity to hold 75 livestock

title: Andhra Pradesh government misusing police powers and targeting opposition leaders, alleges YSRCP
content: Fabricated cases have been filed against the party members, says YSRCP State coordinator Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy

title: Will contest Bihar polls if it improves party’s performance: Chirag Paswan
content: Paswan plays down suggestions of him emerging as the face of the NDA in the election, says there is no vacancy for CM post

title: Railway ministry wants train crew to avoid running-room gossips for safe operations
content: Some of the instructions, besides those mentioned above, said the crew should be counselled about not obtaining operational instructions from the station staff through walkie-talkie and reducing speed gradually when approaching restrictive signal aspects.

title: IMD forecasts minimal rain activity in Andhra Pradesh until June 9 with a slight temperature increase
content: There will be a brief pause in the rainfall activity before it resumes again after June 11. This is a normal rainfall pattern, says Director of IMD Amaravati

title: Hidkal Dam water is being sought for upcoming beverages industries in Dharwad, says Minister
content: M.B. Patil has expressed the confidence that residents will understand the importance of industrial development and will not oppose it

title: KSHEC’s new textbook on Kerala’s knowledge systems sparks objections from teacher bodies
content: Titled Knowledge Systems of Kerala, the textbook is intended as a compulsory multidisciplinary course of the four-year undergraduate programme. However, critics argue that the council is overstepping its bounds by infringing on the authority of statutory academic bodies in universities that are mandated with curriculum development

title: RGUKT students to offer yoga training to 10 lakh people under Yogandhra programme
content: University launches a student-led yoga training programme in all the RGUKT campuses in the State as part of community service

title: CBI slices into pizza bribe plot, IRS officer caught with Rs 1 crore cash, 3.5kg gold
content: IRS officer Amit Kumar Singal and his associate Harsh Kotak were arrested by the CBI for allegedly accepting a ₹25 lakh bribe. Raids on Singal's properties uncovered ₹1 crore in cash, gold, and silver. The arrest followed a complaint by La Pino'z Pizza owner Sanam Kapoor, who accused Singal of demanding money to settle an income tax notice.

title: Cracking Russia’s shield: Inside Ukraine’s drone tactic that took out nuclear bombers
content: Ukraine launched a daring operation, 'Spider’s Web,' using FPV drones to strike 41 Russian warplanes across four airbases, some deep within Siberia. The SBU smuggled drones inside Russia, concealed in trucks, inflicting an estimated $7 billion in damages.

title: 2nd consecration at Ram temple begins today
content: Ayodhya is set for a second consecration ceremony at the Ram temple, starting Tuesday, featuring deity installations in six temples and the Ram Darbar inauguration on June 5. Champat Rai urged devotees to avoid visiting during the 'pran pratishtha' due to weather and limited arrangements. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath will attend the June 5 events, coinciding with Ganga Dussehra.

title: India clears literacy exam with 80.9%, but gender & urban-rural gaps remain
content: The PLFS 2023-24 reveals India's overall literacy rate at 80.9% for those aged seven and above, with Mizoram leading at 98.2%. Significant disparities persist across states, gender, and urban-rural divides. Bihar, Madhya Pradesh, and Rajasthan have the lowest literacy rates, while Rajasthan exhibits the widest gender gap, highlighting the need for focused interventions in education.

title: IPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Playing soon - a song of fire and ice in Ahmedabad
content: Rajat Patidar-led, and Virat Kohli-inspired, RCB face Shreyas Iyer’s calm and calculated Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 final. It’s fire versus ice, emotion versus composure, as both teams chase their maiden IPL title amid looming rain in Ahmedabad.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO's warning to US on China tariffs: They're not scared...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon cautioned American officials against underestimating China's resilience in the trade conflict, highlighting their preparedness and determination. He warned against expecting China to concede to American pressure, emphasizing their capacity to address challenges with significant resources. Dimon also expressed concerns about the United States' overall readiness for future global conflicts, particularly in military strength.

title: Suspects spotted in J&K’s Kathua, search operation launched
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district launched a search operation near a forest following a tip about three suspected terrorists. The area was cordoned off, and a combing operation was initiated after a civilian reported seeing the trio in the Saladhi area of Hiranagar. This operation is part of increased security measures in the region after recent encounters.

title: Economy in dire straits, India's Indus blow: Can Pak avoid ‘begging bowl’?
content: Pakistan's economy faces significant challenges, including a recent GDP growth shortfall and pressures from an IMF program requiring structural changes. India's actions, such as suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and targeting Pakistan's funding sources, exacerbate these difficulties.

title: Who is Megha Vemuri, Indian-American student banned from MIT ceremony
content: Megha Vemuri, MIT's Class of 2025 president, was banned from her graduation after delivering a pro-Palestine speech criticizing the university's ties with Israel. MIT cited disruption of an official event as the reason, leading to online backlash and Vemuri deleting her LinkedIn profile. The incident highlights the ongoing tensions surrounding campus activism and free speech related to the Israel-Gaza conflict.

title: Rickea Jackson shuts down pregnancy rumors after missing the Los Angeles Sparks game
content: Los Angeles Sparks forward Rickea Jackson has addressed pregnancy rumors circulating online following her absence from a recent game. Jackson, listed as “out for personal reasons,” responded with humor, posting a photo on X holding a basketball to her stomach, captioned “#ItsAGirl”. She later clarified she is not pregnant, emphasizing her focus on being a 'rich auntie'.

title: Adivasis say Project Tiger and tourism are displacing them from their ancestral land
content: Indigenous communities in India are facing displacement from their ancestral lands due to tourism and tiger projects, despite laws meant to protect them. Adivasis at a global press briefing highlighted the dilution and improper implementation of these protective measures.

title: Trump asks Supreme Court to overrule lower court block on mass federal layoffs
content: The Trump administration has approached the US Supreme Court. It wants to implement widespread layoffs and agency closures. A lower court had halted these actions. The administration argues it doesn't need Congressional approval for staffing decisions. They call the lower court's ruling indefensible. Critics fear the changes will weaken essential public services.

title: You won’t believe where Pornhub and XNXX are based; and why the EU is coming for them
content: The EU has launched a formal investigation into Pornhub, XNXX, XVideos, and Stripchat, alleging failures to protect children under the Digital Services Act (DSA). Key concerns include inadequate age verification and risk assessments. The platforms, primarily based in Cyprus and the Czech Republic, face potential fines up to 6% of global revenue and operational restrictions if found in violation.

title: Rohit Sharma bows to Arjun Tendulkar after Mumbai Indians' IPL exit - WATCH
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive innings of 87 propelled Punjab Kings to a thrilling five-wicket victory over Mumbai Indians in Qualifier 2, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Mumbai Indians' exit guarantees a first-time champion this season, with captain Hardik Pandya acknowledging Iyer's brilliance and MI's bowling shortcomings under pressure.

title: Preity Zinta's epic 'Punjabi aa gaye oye' shoutout will give you goosebumps
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive 87 propelled Punjab Kings to the IPL 2025 final, defeating Mumbai Indians by five wickets in Qualifier 2. Chasing 204, PBKS was set up by Inglis's quickfire start and Iyer's dominant innings, featuring eight sixes. They will now face Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the final, marking their first appearance since 2014.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's visit, bomb threat triggers panic at Jammu Tawi railway station
content: A bomb threat caused panic at Jammu Tawi railway station ahead of Prime Minister Modi's visit on June 6 to inaugurate the train service to Kashmir. Railway Police conducted a thorough search of the station using sniffer dogs and metal detectors.

title: 'Hygiene not being maintained': Influencer Sharmishta files plea over jail conditions
content: Social media influencer Sharmishta Panoli's arrest for allegedly hurting religious sentiments has sparked controversy. Her advocate claims she's being denied basic rights and her health is deteriorating in custody. Despite deleting the video and apologizing, her arrest has drawn criticism from legal professionals and political figures, who deem it excessive and politically motivated, while police insist all procedures were followed.

title: 'Performed very efficiently': Russia says India to get remaining S-400 systems by 2026
content: Russia is set to complete the delivery of S-400 air defence systems to India by 2025-2026, as confirmed by Russian authorities. The deputy chief of the Russian mission in India highlighted the system's effectiveness and expressed openness to expanding cooperation in air defense and anti-drone technologies, building on the long-standing partnership between the two nations.

title: 'Made a mistake': Ajit Pawar's big admission on Ladki Bahin scheme
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Ajit Pawar admitted the government erred in disbursing Mukhyamantri Majhi Ladki Bahin Yojana funds without proper vetting due to pre-election time constraints. Thousands of ineligible recipients, including government employees, benefited. While funds already disbursed won't be recovered, future payouts will undergo stricter scrutiny.

title: Akash Ambani's emotional speech to Mumbai Indians players - WATCH
content: Mumbai Indians' IPL 2025 journey ended in Qualifier 2 with a loss to Punjab Kings, despite posting a strong 203/6. Shreyas Iyer's explosive innings guided PBKS to victory. MI owner Akash Ambani encouraged the team to learn from the defeat and strive for improvement. PBKS will now face RCB in the final, both teams seeking their first IPL title.

title: Health expert warns about the ‘worst’ drink that can damage the liver
content: Liver diseases are a major global health concern. Dr. Eric Berg warns that hard liquor poses the greatest threat to liver health. It is more dangerous than sugary drinks or even beer and wine. High-proof alcohol overwhelms the liver. This leads to the production of a toxic byproduct. This byproduct damages liver cells and causes inflammation.

title: Frank Ragnow announces retirement, leaving major void in Lions' offensive line
content: Detroit Lions center Frank Ragnow has announced his sudden retirement, citing ongoing health issues. The timing shocks fans, as Ragnow was expected to anchor the offensive line for another season. His departure leaves a major gap and raises questions about whether health was the only reason behind the decision, especially as the team enters a critical phase.

title: BJP MP gives 'India was never poor' reality check in London - Watch
content: During a parliamentary delegation visit to London, BJP MP Samik Bhattacharya highlighted India's historical wealth and colonial exploitation, questioning how much more would be taken. He emphasized India's resilience and global contributions during the pandemic, while also criticizing the hypocrisy of nations that profit from conflict.

title: Russia rejects 'unconditional ceasefire' at Istanbul peace talks with Ukraine
content: Delegations from Ukraine and Russia met in Istanbul for peace talks amidst escalating conflict, following Ukraine's surprise attack on Russian airbases and Russia's intensified drone strikes. Despite cautious optimism, the talks occurred as fighting persisted along the front line, with both sides reporting casualties and drone attacks. Zelenskyy warned of stronger sanctions if the talks fail to yield results.

title: 'World power with loving people': Elon Musk's father Errol on India's global role
content: Errol Musk, father of Elon Musk, lauded India's commitment to green technology during his Delhi visit, highlighting the country's potential in sustainability and energy efficiency. He expressed interest in Indian companies like Servotec that contribute to electricity conservation. While cautiously addressing Tesla's entry, he acknowledged India's rising power demands and admired its ancient civilization and spirituality.

title: Drone-acharya: How Ukraine changed the game in aerial warfare
content: The Ukrainian Security Service (SBU), which claimed responsibility for the operation, said the drones were covertly transported across Russian territory and launched from makeshift enclosures hidden in civilian-looking trucks. Once in proximity to the target airfields, the drone swarms were deployed and flown directly at parked aircraft. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy called the operation a “brilliant” achievement and said it had been in planning for 18 months.

title: 'I hardly had four hours of sleep and ... ': Shreyas Iyer opens up
content: Shreyas Iyer's explosive 87* propelled Punjab Kings past Mumbai Indians in Qualifier 2, securing their spot in the IPL 2025 final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Chasing 204, Punjab Kings were powered by Iyer and Wadhera's crucial partnership. Iyer, who previously led KKR to victory, sealed the win with eight sixes, calling it his 'top most knock' in the IPL.

title: IndiGo flight hit by vulture at 4,000 ft, makes emergency landing in Ranchi
content: An IndiGo flight en route from Patna to Ranchi, carrying 175 passengers, executed an emergency landing in Ranchi after a vulture strike. The incident occurred at approximately 1:14 pm while the aircraft was flying at an altitude of 3,000 to 4,000 feet. All passengers are safe, though the aircraft sustained a dent, and engineers are currently evaluating the damage.

title: 'Forged papers, illegal route': How 'job-seekers' use Nepal-Bihar-Mumbai corridor to reach Gulf
content: Mumbai airport saw the arrest of ten Nepali citizens. They were attempting to fly to Gulf countries using fake documents. These individuals allegedly crossed the Bihar border illegally. They paid agents approximately Rs 2.5 lakh each. Some even obtained Indian passports fraudulently. Authorities are investigating the agents involved.

title: Will Matt Chapman play tonight against San Diego Padres? Latest update
content: All eyes are on Matt Chapman as San Francisco Giants face San Diego Padres. Chapman had a collision during a previous game. Fans are curious about his fitness. No official injury report is available. He is likely to play, given his recent participation. The final decision will be announced before the game at Oracle Park.

title: Salman Khurshid's message to 'people at home': 'Is it so difficult to be patriotic?'
content: Salman Khurshid voiced concerns about India's political divisions. This happened as a multi-party delegation travels abroad. The delegation aims to highlight India’s united stance against terrorism. Khurshid is part of the delegation in East Asia. Shashi Tharoor, in Brazil, echoed similar sentiments. Congress party leaders have attacked the Modi government on Operation Sindoor.

title: NEET PG 2025 postponed: NBE to announce fresh dates shortly, check details here
content: The National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) has postponed the NEET PG 2025 exam, previously scheduled for June 15, 2025. This decision follows Supreme Court orders to conduct the exam in a single shift. Fresh dates for the examination, city intimation slip, and admit card will be announced shortly due to the need for more test centers.

title: Emmanuel Macron’s wax statue stolen from Grevin Museum in Paris
content: Three individuals, reportedly identifying themselves as Greenpeace activists, stole French President Emmanuel Macron's wax figure from the Grevin Museum in Paris on Monday. The individuals, consisting of two women and a man, gained entry disguised as tourists before absconding with the statue through an emergency exit.

title: Why Tampa Bay Rays' shortstop Taylor Walls ejected amid play for tapping on his helmet?
content: During a recent game between the Tampa Bay Rays and Houston Astros, shortstop Taylor Walls tapped his helmet, leading to a misunderstanding with home plate umpire Nic Lentz. Lentz interpreted the gesture as a challenge to a strike call, though Walls claimed it was unintentional while adjusting his helmet. The incident sparked debate about the potential for miscommunication in baseball.

title: Edmonton Oilers shut up the critics including one of Hockey’s loudest voices
content: Once labeled soft and overrated, the Edmonton Oilers have silenced their critics with a gritty run to the Stanley Cup Final. Their all-around play has impressed fans—and even turned one of their harshest critics, Daryl Reaugh, into a believer. With stars buying into team-first hockey, the Oilers are proving they’re more than just talent, they’re contenders.

title: These 7 mistakes in ITR filing this year can cost you big
content: To avoid Income Tax Department notices, taxpayers should file error-free returns, especially with the extended deadline to September 15 due to Budget 2024's ITR form modifications. Common mistakes include incorrect form selection, AIS/Form 26AS verification failures, incomplete income declaration, and overlooking changes from Budget 2024. Accurate HRA claims and proper handling of income from previous employers are also crucial.

title: 'Office' of op on Russian turf: How Ukraine executed massive drone assault
content: Ukraine's audacious "Spider's Web" operation, meticulously planned over 18 months, struck 41 Russian aircraft at military airfields. The operation, incredibly coordinated from an office near Russian intelligence, involved smuggling drones into Russia and launching them from nearby locations using concealed trucks. The attack targeted key assets, potentially crippling a significant portion of Russia's air-launched missile capabilities.

title: What happens if RCB vs PBKS IPL Final gets washed out?
content: Virat Kohli's Royal Challengers Bengaluru clashes with Shreyas Iyer's Punjab Kings in the IPL 2025 final, a defining moment in Kohli's quest for a title. Rain looms as a potential disruptor at the Narendra Modi Stadium. Punjab Kings hold an edge if weather cancels play, having topped the league stage.

title: CBSE 2025: How these students scored 99% plus without studying all day
content: CBSE toppers of 2025 have shown that success is not just about marks, but about the mindset behind them. From Tanvi Sharma’s Social Science surprise to Naisha Manchanda’s consistent excellence and Deepshikha Prasad’s passion-fuelled discipline, each story reflects resilience, balance, and a deep love for learning—proving that true achievement lies in the journey, not just the percentage.

title: Trump’s 50% steel tariffs seen as ‘minor impact’ for India: Steel min Kumaraswamy
content: India anticipates a limited effect from President Trump's proposed steel and aluminium tariff increase due to relatively low export volumes to the US. While the steel minister downplayed concerns, Fitch Ratings suggests potential challenges for Indian steel producers if other nations redirect exports to India.

title: WWE RAW preview, streaming details: Full match card, confirmed segments, and more
content: WWE's RAW on June 2, 2025, from Tulsa, Oklahoma, will feature crucial Money in the Bank qualifying matches. CM Punk, AJ Styles, and El Grande Americano will battle in a triple-threat match for a spot in the men's ladder match. Simultaneously, Liv Morgan, Stephanie Vaquer, and Ivy Nile will compete for the final spot in the women's MITB match.

title: Ram Gopal Varma backs Kamal Haasan: Calls ‘Thug Life’ ban threats hooliganism
content: Kamal Haasan's remark about Kannada's origin ignited a controversy in Karnataka, threatening the release of 'Thug Life.' Ram Gopal Varma criticized the backlash as 'hooliganism,' while Karnataka leaders demanded an apology. Haasan defended his statement, leading to a High Court plea for film release protection amidst rising linguistic tensions.

title: 'Don't see myself in national politics for long': Chirag Paswan's big update
content: Union Minister Chirag Paswan is considering a return to Bihar state politics, driven by his commitment to the state's development. Despite securing a third term as Lok Sabha MP, Paswan feels he can better serve Bihar by focusing on state-level issues.

title: Ankur Warikoo shares how he overcame medical condition to go 'fat-free' at 44
content: Avascular necrosis (AVN), also known as osteonecrosis (not to be confused with osteoporosis) or bone infarction, is a serious medical condition where bone tissue dies because it does not get enough blood supply. Without blood, the bone cells lose oxygen and nutrients, causing the bone to weaken and eventually collapse
